#Text=Ghanaians elect new President
#Text=Saturday , January 3 , 2009
#Text=University of Ghana
#Text=law professor John Atta Mills , age 64 , was confirmed on Saturday as the winner of the runoff presidential election , the fifth in Ghana since the return to multi-party democracy in 1992 .

#Text=According to Electoral Commission Chair , Kwadwo Afari-Gyan , Atta Mills obtained 50.23 percent of ballots cast on December 28 , or 4,521,032 votes , while Nana Akufo-Addo got 49.77 percent or 4,480,446 votes .

#Text=Despite the ruling party 's call to boycott , the Tain local election officer also announced that Atta-Mills obtained 19,566 votes in Friday 's special election there , while Nana Akufo-Addo had only 2,053 ballots .
#Text=In the parliamentary elections , Atta Mills ’s NDC won 114 seats to the NPP ’s 107 .
#Text=Minor parties and independent candidates won seven seats while two are still being contested .
#Text=President John Kufuor appealed for sobriety and urged the candidates to accept the official result .
#Text=A presidential election was held in Ghana on 7 December 2008 , at the same time as a parliamentary election .
#Text=Eight candidates contested the first round of voting .
#Text=Ghana
#Text=' s electoral commission announced on December 10 that a run-off election must be held on 28 December , 2008 for the Ghanaian presidency .

#Text=The commission said that the New Patriotic Party ( NPP ) candidate Nana Addo Dankwa Akufo-Addo won 49.13 % of the vote , slightly more than the other main candidate , John Atta Mills of the National Democratic Congress ( NDC ) , who obtained 47.92 % .
#Text=However , neither candidate reached the 50 % mark needed to declare an outright winner to succeed President John Kufuor , who will step down after two terms .
#Text=Turnout on election day was very high .
#Text=Out of some 8.6 million votes cast , more than 200,000 , or 2.4 % of the full total , were rejected .
#Text=Overall voter turnout in the election was 69.52 % .
#Text=The second round was to be rerun on 2 January 2009 in the Tain District due to ballot papers irregularities .

#Text=As the number of voters in Tain , which has a constituency of about 53,000 eligible voters , exceeded Atta Mills ' margin of victory without the results , the Election Commission stated it would not announce Atta Mills as the winner until after the election rerun in Tain .

#Text=The NPP sought to delay voting in Tain as it claimed that " the atmosphere in the rural district was not conducive to a free and fair election " , but the court said it would only hear the case on January 5 , denying the NPP an injunction .
#Text=The NPP then proceeded to call for a voting boycott , for which it was criticized by civil groups .

#Text=On December 21 , 2006 , former Vice-President John Atta-Mills , who unsuccessfully ran as the National Democratic Congress ( NDC ) presidential candidate in 2000 and 2004 , was overwhelmingly elected by NDC as its candidate for the 2008 presidential election .
#Text=Former Foreign Minister Nana Addo Dankwa Akufo-Addo was elected as the 2008 presidential candidate of the governing New Patriotic Party ( NPP ) at a party congress on December 23 , 2007 .
#Text=Although he fell short of the required 50 % , the second-place candidate , John Alan Kyeremanten , conceded defeat and backed Akufo-Addo .
